The binding energy is dependent on the element from which the electron was emitted, and therefore the spectra provides information of the electronic structure of the sample material from which elemental and chemical composition and can be determined
45 . To obtain the stoichiometric content for the photocathodes presented in this work, the relative peak intensity of the Sb 3 d, K 2 p and Cs 3 d peaks from the XPS survey spectra were quantitatively analysed using CasaXPS in conjunction with a custom PYTHON code
27 . The ratio for two concentrations ( c
a and c
b ) were determined using Eq. ( 4):
